author: A D
text:
Four devotees, including a temple volunteer, drowned in the tank of Sri Arunachaleswarar Temple here following a stampede on Monday.

The devotees were taking a dip at the Ayyankula Theertham as part of the ‘mahodaya punyakala theerthavaari’ (a ritual as part of which the processional deity — utsava murthi — is taken for a dip) that comes once in several years.

A handful of police personnel present at the spot could do nothing as the crowd surged ahead desperately, resulting in a stampede. There were no safety arrangements like hand railings or life jackets in the pond.

Hindu Munnani District President Shankar condemned the temple administration for lack of arrangements and lack of police protection.

Fire and rescue services personnel said the temple administration had not sought assistance . Hence, they were called in only after the mishap incident took place. The dead were identified as Manikandan (32), Siva (30), Venkataraman (30) and Punyakoti (52).
title: Stampede at temple; 4 devotees drown
